DataElement.preferredName: Patient Exempt From Submitting Follow-up Data Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that describes the reason why a patient would not provide follow-up information.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Exemption From Submission Follow-up Data
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Immunity from an obligation or duty._Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument._Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done._A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Immunity from an obligation or duty.:Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.:Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.:The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.:A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.

Concepts.definition: Immunity from an obligation or duty.
Used to indicate a specified place or time as a starting point; used to indicate a source, cause, agent, or instrument.
Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for TCGA Follow-up Exemption Form per request by A.Spencer. mc 1/30/2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Communication Contact Lost With Submitting Facility

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Communication Contact Lost With Submitting Facility
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A channel for communication between groups.: Parted with; no longer held or possessed; incapable of being recovered or regained.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: The hospital or medical institution that is submitting data or information.

Concepts.definition: A channel for communication between groups.
Parted with; no longer held or possessed; incapable of being recovered or regained.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
The hospital or medical institution that is submitting data or information.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a study participant has removed itself from the study.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a study participant has removed themself from the study or from one or more segments of the study.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for TCGA per request by A.Spencer. mc 12/30/13
